## When is the next Steam Sale? Best Halloween Sale 2018 deals and Halloween
sale dates

**Your guide to the next Steam Sale, including all the latest news regarding
the Steam Halloween Sale 2018, plus what to expect from the Steam Black Friday
Sale and Winter Sale. Everything you need to know is right here in one handy
place.**

Taking place regularly throughout the year, Steam Sales offer some of the
year’s absolute best PC gaming deals. 2018 means an entire year of new
seasonal sales that will likely crop up in the Spring, Summer and just in time
for Halloween, Black Friday and Christmas.

While Valve rarely releases details of its Steam Sales in advance, the
internet is pretty handy at digging up details of upcoming sales and we’ve got
all the latest rumours on the next Steam Halloween Sale, which is taking place
right now on the digital storefront.

**Related:[Black Friday 2018 UK](https://www.trustedreviews.com/deals/best-

## When is the next Steam Sale? Steam Halloween Sale 2018 dates and times

The Steam Halloween Sale has now begun on the digital gaming storefront across
all territories, Valve recently announced on social media.

> 🎃 STEAM HALLOWEEN SALE 🎃 Save big on spooky titles from now 'til November
1st!

>

> 🔍 Learn more: <https://t.co/3uA7CiT8Jt>
[pic.twitter.com/BaFWl04kxP](https://t.co/BaFWl04kxP)

>

> — Steam (@steam_games) [October 29,
2018](https://twitter.com/steam_games/status/1056969343571976196?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

In terms of times, it is now active and will conclude on November 1st at 10am
PT/5pm BST/1pm ET. So you’ll have a handful of days, including Halloween, to
take advantage of some spooky deals on PC. Keep an eye on this page as we’ll
be adding some of our favourite discounts in the coming days.

## The Best Steam Halloween Sale deals live right now

There’s a lot of great stuff in the Halloween sale, but here’s our pick of
some of the best options.

[**Dark Souls III –
£9.99**](https://store.steampowered.com/app/374320/DARK_SOULS_III/) **/**[
**Dark Souls III Deluxe Edition:
£17.99**](https://store.steampowered.com/app/374320/DARK_SOULS_III/) Okay, so
Dark Souls III is too hard for most of us here in the office, but if you want
to roll and block your way to victory in a dark fantasy world, this is worth a
look.

[**Rocket League –
£8.99**](https://store.steampowered.com/app/252950/Rocket_League/) Vehicular
kickabout Rocket League is the must-have multiplayer game, as it is easy to
pick up, hard to master, has no violence and is absolutely hilarious. If
you’ve got friends, or you think you might one day have friends, this is worth
a purchase.

[**Friday the 13th –
£4.49**](https://store.steampowered.com/app/438740/Friday_the_13th_The_Game/)
A game of two sides: on one, you play as Jason Vorhees and hunt down a variety
of campers to do a murder on them with your mighty weapon and the environment
around them. On the other, you don’t play as Jason, and you try to put off
your inevitable demise as long as possible.

[**The Witcher 3 –
£13.99**](https://store.steampowered.com/app/292030/The_Witcher_3_Wild_Hunt/)
This critically acclaimed RPG is a phenomenal title to lose yourself to. Buy
The Witcher 3 on the strength of its several million game of the year awards,
and prepare to lose all of your free time until the new year.

[**No Man’s Sky –
£19.99**](https://store.steampowered.com/app/275850/No_Mans_Sky/) After a
disappointing launch, No Man’s Sky quietly became one of the best space
exploration games ever made. Among the features the team added, there’s now
multiplayer, buildable bases and a recent Halloween content drop called the
Abyss that makes things extra spooky.

[**Warhammer Vermintide 2:
£11.89**](https://store.steampowered.com/app/552500/Warhammer_Vermintide_2/)
Kill rats, orcs and chaos minions in Fatshark’s Vermintide sequel. Warhammer:
Vermintide 2 is a compelling first person title with a focus on melee, and
it’s all fun and games until you get punted into the middle distance by an
angry troll.

[**Dead By Daylight:
£7.49**](https://store.steampowered.com/app/381210/Dead_by_Daylight/) This
horror game is, for my money, the best multiplayer horror title out there.
Dead By Daylight takes advantage of several strong licensing deals to let
killers stalk and kill the opposing team using Michael Myers, Leatherface or
even the woman from Saw that used to help Jigsaw out. She’s wearing a pig mask
here. Spooky.

[**Terraria: £3.49**](https://store.steampowered.com/app/105600/Terraria/)
What if Metroid, Zelda and Minecraft had a 2D baby? Terraria. That’s what.
This is a great adventure game with the ability to let you do a variety of fun
building and crafting, but also has some challenging boss fights and a
surprising amount of depth. Better yet, it’s co-operative. Pour one out for
the canned sequel.

[**Left 4 Dead 2:
£1.43**](https://store.steampowered.com/app/550/Left_4_Dead_2/) Zombies, 4
player co-op and some cracking set pieces, Valve’s classic set the standard
for online cooperative games.

[**Prey: £9.99**](https://store.steampowered.com/app/480490/Prey/) One of the
best immersive sims of the last few years, Arkane’s space simulator is a
cracker.

[**Payday 2: Ultimate Edition:
£8.54**](https://store.steampowered.com/bundle/3756/PAYDAY_2_Ultimate_Edition/)
Team up with friends, do crimes. Payday 2 has some fantastic action sequences,
but it never loses focus on the characters primary goal: to grab as much cash
as is physically possible. Also John Wick is a playable character.

[**Graveyard Keeper = £
11.61**](https://store.steampowered.com/app/599140/Graveyard_Keeper/) Like
Stardew Valley, but with fresh corpses.

## When is the next Steam Sale? Steam Black Friday and Christmas sale dates
and times

For reference, here’s when the ‘big four’ Steam Sales kicked off in 2017:

  * **Steam Summer Sale:** June 22
  * **Steam Halloween Sale:** October 26
  * **Steam Black Friday Sale:** November 22
  * **Steam Winter Sale:** December 21

That’s all we know right now, but we can expect to learn much more in the very
near future, so stay tuned to _Trusted Reviews_ for all your Steam Sale needs.
